blog.name: omgellendean
blog.title: Catelyn Stark was mean to the godswood

summary: Recently, I was thinking about that one place from Bran’s chapters in ACoK:  The smoke and ash clouded his eyes, and in the sky...
body:
Recently, I was thinking about that one place from Bran’s chapters in ACoK:

The smoke and ash clouded his eyes, and in the sky he saw a great winged snake whose roar was a river of flame. — A Clash of Kings - Bran VII

I was wondering what could it mean because in this passage we are seeing things from Summer’s PoV and the wording is somewhat unclear. And it was guessed that it’s the vision of the future or of the past, or that it’s some kind of a magical neon sign of Jon’s parentage that hangs over Winterfell. But now I think there might be a much simpler explanation.

He bared his teeth, but then the snake was gone. Behind the cliffs tall fires were eating up the stars.

The snake was gone because tall fires were eating up the stars. –> Because of fire, it was too light to see the stars, and it was too light to see the snake. The snake with a fiery roar is a star, too. The bleeding star.

tags: i just read another fic where he dies and i am tired
summary: i don’t know why people still think bran is going to die at the end of the series. his story isn’t about a grand sacrifice for...
body: i don’t know why people still think bran is going to die at the end of the series. his story isn’t about a grand sacrifice for his family, it’s about a boy who thought he could accomplish nothing because of his disability only for him to save the world. he becomes a knight of a different sort and then he becomes a builder like his ancestor.

summary: i really want book bran to communicate with sansa through a weirwood tree. sansa has been carrying grief for a long time and she...
body: i really want book bran to communicate with sansa through a weirwood tree. sansa has been carrying grief for a long time and she thinks she only has jon left. i can just imagine how emotional she’d get if she heard her little brother and realised he was alive.

summary: i don’t know if people have been talking about this as i haven’t recently done much looking into GOT season 8 stuff, but i...
caption:
i don’t know if people have been talking about this as i haven’t recently done much looking into GOT season 8 stuff, but i finally got a look at the full cast photo for the EW coverage and this stood out to me

in the midst of all these characters, many of whom have been the leads whether contractually or story-wise, it is the three Stark kids who stand at the center of this photo and the others are off to the side

now i don’t know if this has any meaning, i don’t know how much we can read into it, but it is just intriguing that the Stark kids could have been placed off to the side with Dany and Jon in the center or anyone else, yet it is the three Stark kids

and not just that, but their position pretty much puts Sansa at the center of this photo - there are exactly 10 people on each side of her - is this suppose to mean something? is she ultimately the center of the story where she is going to somehow end up being the Queen?

and back to just the three Stark kids for a second, now years ago when i was in college, around the time when the Red Wedding aired, my TV fantasy class was lucky to have had a face to face conversation with GRRM and he spoke very much about how they had been lucky in casting Isaac, Sophie, and Maisie as the three Stark kids and how important their casting was because they would be the future in carrying the show as they got older, and here they are now, the very heart and center of this EW photo - i can’t help but feel GRRM must be feeling pretty proud of these three kids

again, i don’t know if this photo truly has any meaning in what’s going to happen in the final season, but i just thought it is interesting that here at the end of it all, at the final big EW coverage for this show, it is the Stark kids who are placed front and center - i guess “the wolves will come again” is right

Bran: Excuse me? I lost my siblings. Can I please make an announcement?

blog.name: asongofstarkandtargaryen
blog.title: Dracarys!
blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

question: 🔥jojen reed
answer:
I’m probably the shame of Bran’s fandom because originally I didn’t liked much Jojen. I had nothing against him and I believe he is a crucial character to Bran’s development but I found him kinda boring. I was much more interested at his sister Meera.

However, on the show I liked him better. Partly because of the actor who portrayed him and partly because of the good chemistry of him and Bran.

So, I think it’s a pity he was killed off before his time. He still had a lot to offer and his presence would make Bran’s storyline more compelling (but we all know that D&D don’t give a shit and Bran and his story).

blog.name: twhiddlegirl
blog.title: - I'm freaky -
blog.description:
“You,” Ned said, kissing her lightly on the brow, “will marry a king and rule his castle, and your sons will be knights and princes and lords and, yes, perhaps even a High Septon.”
"Corn,” the bird said, and, “King," and, “Snow, Jon Snow, Jon Snow.” That was queer. The bird had never said his full name before, as best Jon could recall.
Bring her home, Mance... You owe me this one little girl.
She found herself wishing that Jon was here with her now.
What do you know of my heart, priestess? What do you know of my sister?
Needle was Jon Snow's smile.﻿

summary: I don't get any of the jonsa theories that jon will need sansa politically because i would think that sansa and the rest of the...
question: I don't get any of the jonsa theories that jon will need sansa politically because i would think that sansa and the rest of the starklings would support jon no matter what because he is their brother and they love him.  Also bran is the heir to winterfell, not jon or sansa.  They always forget that bran is the lord even though right now he wants to defeat the threat up north.  Any political angle for jonsa just makes no sense.
answer:
This theory doesn’t make any sense. I believe it’s wishful thinking of the jon//sa shippers who just want to link their(crack) pairing to political importance when in reality there would be nothing to be gained from such wedding. 


As you already pointed out, Sansa - and the rest of the Stark kids-will support Jon no matter what. He doesn’t have to marry one or all three of them in order to be given their support - he is their brother and they will have his back no matter what. As Ned Stark used to say ‘the lone wolf dies but the pack survives “. This quote and the philosophy behind it mean a lot to the Stark kids, Sansa included. 


Furthermore, even if Sansa didn’t give her support to Jon without a wedding (which would be out of character for her but let’s imagine this for the sake of assumption) Jon would still not need her. The Northerners have already chosen Jon over Sansa for their King. He has the highest authority in the North and everyone is technically his inferior in terms of social standing. So he doesnt need to marry the lady of winterfell in order to have the north’s trust or loyalty. He already won that. 


About Bran, he is the heir to Winterfell in the books. But on the show he didn’t want that position so he gave it to his sister, Sansa. I don’t expect anything similar to happen on the books though, because book! Bran is very responsible and would never given up something that not only is his heritage but his duty as well.

summary:
Time for the occasional art update 👀🙃
I'm working on another game of thrones set (I know, shocking). Hopefully I'll be finished...
body:
Time for the occasional art update 👀🙃

I’m working on another game of thrones set (I know, shocking). Hopefully I’ll be finished with it before season 8 drops; so many characters to get through! Here’s some of Bran’s, since he’s pretty much complete.

summary: I tend to think Old Nan's stories are true, even though the characters all think they are just stories. So, that said, do you...
question: I tend to think Old Nan's stories are true, even though the characters all think they are just stories. So, that said, do you think we'll get giant ice spiders?
answer:
Here’s what Sam finds in the Watch archives:

“I found mention of dragonglass. The children of the forest used to give the Night’s Watch a hundred obsidian daggers every year, during the Age of Heroes. The Others come when it is cold, most of the tales agree. Or else it gets cold when they come. Sometimes they appear during snowstorms and melt away when the skies clear. They hide from the light of the sun and emerge by night…or else night falls when they emerge. Some stories speak of them riding the corpses of dead animals. Bears, direwolves, mammoths, horses, it makes no matter, so long as the beast is dead. The one that killed Small Paul was riding a dead horse, so that part’s plainly true. Some accounts speak of giant ice spiders too. I don’t know what those are. Men who fall in battle against the Others must be burned, or else the dead will rise again as their thralls.”

- Sam I, AFFC

We know from Sam I, ASoS, that he too got stories of ice spiders accompanying the Others. Two more sources of ice spiders. I think the chances are good.

summary:
Sansa: Everyone, synchronize your watches.
Rickon: I don’t know how to do that.
Arya: I don’t wear a watch.
Bran: Time is a...
body:
Sansa: Everyone, synchronize your watches.

Rickon: I don’t know how to do that.

Arya: I don’t wear a watch.

Bran: Time is a construct.
